snippet: The City Council will vote on whether to give school bus companies $42 million to raise the salaries of experienced drivers.
abstract: New York City Council, with Mayor Bill de Blasio's support, is planning to vote to give $42 million to school bus companies to raise salaries of experienced drivers; move is part of effort to reverse some of the policies instituted under former Mayor Michael R Bloomberg that led drivers to strike in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The City Council will vote on whether to give school bus companies $42 million to raise the salaries of experienced drivers.

headline.main: School Bus Drivers May Receive More Pay From New York
headline.print_headline: Council Vote Could Give Bus Drivers More Pay
